titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the James Daniel Theberge Papers, 1963-1988
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by The Hoover Institution Staff; machine-readable finding aid created by James Ryan and Samira Bozorgi.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-14T13:19-0800

Theberge Papers)//EN" "theberge.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item></change><change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120730" era="ce">July 30, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden</item>

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, memoranda, reports, schedules, printed matter, and photographs, relating to diplomatic relations between the United States and Chile; political, social and economic conditions in Chile; United States foreign policy in Latin America; and communist movements in Latin America. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

physdesc.label: General Physical Description note
physdesc.extent: Number of Containers: 52 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Daniel Theberge Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1988.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note

chronitem.event: Economic advisor to U.S. embassy, Buenos Aires, Argentina
Author, La Transformacion del capitalismo en el ciglo XX
Director of Latin American and Hispanic Studies Center, Georgetown University

bioghist.p: Source: "James Daniel Theberge." Contemporary Authors Online. Detroit: Gale, 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers relate to diplomatic relations between the United States and Chile; political, social and economic conditions in Chile; United States foreign policy in Latin America; and communist movements in Latin America. They are comprised of correspondence, speeches and writings, dispatches, memoranda, reports, schedules, printed matter, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes related notes and research materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes notes, draft writings, collected articles, and other materials mainly on Chile and Chilean politics.
